intro: Thysanella, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their broad, velvety leaves and showy, often yellow or red flowers. Thysanella species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. They are sometimes considered invasive in certain areas due to their rapid growth and ability to spread easily. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in ornamental horticulture.
